intro: Cassine domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. Its leaves are usually large, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Cassine domingensis is often found growing in moist, shaded areas near rivers or in forest understories.
